creditline: Gift of Leo and Doris Hodroff
description: enameled center of saucer and interior of bowl have sepia-colored roundel with large western building in parkland; borders and exterior of bowl enameled with lappets over deep blue-green ground, applied with thick globules of red, green and pink set over small gilt flowerheads and applied white metal stars
markings: on bottom of each piece: collector\'s stickers
text: The SÃ¨vres porcelain factory in France perfected this "jeweled" enamel decoration in the 1760s.  Soon after, factories in neighboring countries and as far away as China began producing their own versions.
title: "Jewelled" teabowl and saucer
